words.definition: If two things are alike, they are similar.
words.example: The two brothers look alike.

words.definition: To annoy someone is to bother them a little.
words.example: The fly annoyed me while I was trying to sleep.

words.definition: Architecture is the style or design of a building.
words.example: The architecture of the church is very old.

words.definition: If something is artificial, it is not natural.
words.example: She put artificial flowers in the vase.

words.definition: A chain is a series of connected metal rings.
words.example: I put a chain on my bike to keep it safe.

words.definition: When something is distinct, it is easily noticed.
words.example: There is a distinct difference between the two.

words.definition: To distinguish is to see the difference between things.
words.example: I cannot distinguish between the two colors.

words.definition: Dust is tiny pieces of dirt in the air.
words.example: There was a lot of dust on the old books.

words.definition: Excitement is a feeling of being very happy.
words.example: There was a lot of excitement before the party.

words.definition: To heal is to become healthy again.
words.example: The wound on my leg healed quickly.

words.definition: To inherit is to get something from someone who has died.
words.example: He inherited a lot of money from his father.

words.definition: A manner is the way that someone does something.
words.example: He answered the question in a polite manner.

words.definition: To mount something is to go up or get on it.
words.example: The man mounted his horse and rode away.

words.definition: A roof is the top part of a building.
words.example: The rain made a sound on the roof.

words.definition: A shortage is when there is not enough of something.
words.example: There is a shortage of water in the desert.

words.definition: If something is solid, it is hard and firm.
words.example: The ice is solid enough to walk on.

words.definition: A stock is a supply of something.
words.example: We have a large stock of food in the house.

words.definition: A substance is a type of material.
words.example: Water is a liquid substance.

words.definition: A tomb is a place where a dead person is buried.
words.example: The king was buried in a grand tomb.

words.definition: A wound is an injury to the body.
words.example: He had a wound on his arm from the accident.
